title: Police Data Collection Request (2021)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)
 
2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
6. the total number of officer involved shootings in 2021, both fatal and non-fatal.
 
When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.
 
Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2021)
communications.communication:

I wanted to follow up on the following California Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on June 13, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

title: Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaints from 2010-2022

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaints from 2010-2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All "Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaint Requests" submitted to Chicago 311 from January 1st, 2010 to January 1, 2022. I am requesting the "complaint request" in the category of "Air Pollution, Odor or Dust," which is the raw intake of "Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaint Requests." Last August, I received  this data for the year of 2022 (https://www.muckrock.com/foi/chicago-169/air-pollution-odor-or-dust-complaint-request-132006/). I'm requesting the same data, in the same form, but for the years 2010 to 2022. 

Thus, I request the raw data - in a machine-readable database or spreadsheet format such as Excel, CSV, Access, SQL or XML - pertaining to "Air Pollution, Odor or Dust Complaint Requests." The data should include all fields in the database or spreadsheets that contain non-exempt information. I also request all documentation that describes the layout of the database’s tables and fields, and that provides the definitions of any field names, codes, and abbreviations used in the database. This information may be gathered together in a single document like a data dictionary, entity layout, or user's guide. If that is the case, I request access to and copy of said document.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

Dear Mr. Bergin,

Due to the volume of records associated with the 12-year time period of your FOIA request, additional research from the retired legacy system, records review and report development for different reporting applications is necessary to complete your FOIA request.

As such, this is an official request for an additional extension of 3 business days needed to complete the task.

If this is amenable, please reply to this email.

Thank you in advance for your consideration.

Sincerely,

M.D. Ward
Freedom of Information Act Officer
311 City Services
e: 311foia@cityofchicago.org
p: 312-746-9760

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request #F038527-012023
communications.communication:
Hi M.D.,

This is completely fine by me! I appreciate your time and effort in navigating the changes to 311 system historically. 

If there is a way to fulfill this request for the more recent system data, and give you more time to fulfill the data from the old system, I would also be amendable to that. I can imagine the older system and data won't be as smooth of retrieval process on your end. 

Thanks for your help. 

My best,
Dillon

title: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022. 
Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rex Anthony Sites

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 8, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

On behalf of the district's Public Records Officer Simone Neal, and pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this email acknowledges receipt of the public records request you submitted to the Mukilteo School District on December 8, 2022.  Specifically, you requested:

"Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

"Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."

The district is processing your request.  The district anticipates that the first installment of records responsive to your request will be available no later than February 1, 2023.  This additional time is necessary, per RCW 42.56.520, to locate and assemble the information requested, to determine whether any of the information you requested is exempt from public disclosure and produce a corresponding exemption log, and to notify any third party affected by the request.  As documents responsive to your request are ready for disclosure, they will be provided to you.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

Mukilteo School District
9401 Sharon Drive
Everett, Washington 98204

barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu<mailto:barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In my December 15, 2022, email to you in response to your December 8, 2022 request for records, I estimated the first installment of those records would be available to you by February 1, 2023.

In our subsequent search for records, we have found over 23,300 email records that may be responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

With the way your request is worded and in order to provide you with all the emails you are requesting, we will need to review each one of the 23,300 records to determine if they are responsive and possibly make redactions to the records.  This will take a significant amount of time.  Therefore, we invite you to narrow your request.  Are there any more specific terms you would like to provide regarding specific complaints or individuals for whom you are looking for records?

If you would like to proceed with your request as written, please let me know and I will update the expected timeline for processing the request.  I look forward to receiving a reply from you about how you would like to proceed with your request.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Per RCW 42.56. 250(12), I am providing you with a copy of the third party notification to Ms. Carnahan (formerly Donovan), as attached hereto.

Please note, the record has been redacted per RCW 42.56.230(3).  Ms. Carnahan's personal email address has been redacted because disclosing it would violate her right to privacy.  Please also note that, due to a delay in providing the notification and the need to provide her with 10 days' notice before releasing the records, our initial installment of responsive records will be delayed approximately one week, to February 9,, 2023.

Finally, please see my previous email below regarding a possible narrowing of the other item from your December 8, 2022 request, to which you have not yet responded.  Have a good day.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Attached is the first installment of records responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."  A redaction log is also included.

The district will continue its search for records for this request and also for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

As another reminder, on January 25 I invited you to narrow your search to help expedite the search for records responsive to the Cisco Gomez item above.  After further searching, we have reduced the number of potentially responsive email records to 12,810, which will take a significant amount of time to review.  Absent an updated request to revise our search, we will continue to search based on your original request.

At this time. we anticipate a second installment of records will be sent to you no later than April 1, 2023.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

title: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Northwest Florida State College)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Northwest Florida State College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf.  This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement. 

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

3. Any records (including correspondence) sent to the provided in response to Memo No. 23-021, sent on December 28, 2022 by Chris Spencer, Director of the Office of Policy and Budget, directing each institution of higher education to provide certain information by Friday, January 13, 2023.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: NYC CCRB supplemental data

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYC CCRB supplemental data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing, for each inactive and active uniformed member of service of the NYPD, the following information:
* MOS tax ID
* MOS sex
* MOS race/ethinicity
* MOS age (or year of birth)
* Date MOS was appointed to NYPD
* History of ranks held by MOS, with dates of changes in rank and shield number associated with each rank held by MOS
* History of command assignment of MOS, with date MOS was assigned to each new command
* MOS highest level of educational achievement
* Each allegation of misconduct lodged with the CCRB against the MOS, with the following information:
      -- CCRB case number
      -- IAB Log number if available
      -- agency that allegation was investigated by (ie please indicate referrals to IAB, Chief of Department, or other agencies, or if CCRB kept the allegation)
      -- whether the allegation was fully investigated
      -- race, sex, and age of the allegation victim
      -- if possible, a unique identifier for alleged victims so that victims filing more than one complaint can be connected across multiple cases
      -- precinct of occurrence
      -- address of occurrence (can be anonymized to the nearest 100 street address or to street segment/intersection)
      -- reason for initial contact
      -- criminal justice outcome of incident (e.g. arrest, summons, neither)
      -- whether BWC footage was available
      -- whether video was available from another source
      -- whether victim was injured
      -- whether officer was injured
      -- FADO category and specification (e.g. search, physical force, rude gesture, etc) of misconduct alleged
      -- date of occurrence, date of filing of complaint, date of filing of recommendations by CCRB staff, date of disposition by CCRB Board for each allegation
      -- outcome recommended to the CCRB Board by staff
      -- CCRB Board disposition
      -- For substantiated allegations, whether DAO or APU prosecuted and the disposition (ie dropped by prosecutor, pleaded guilty, trial)
      -- For cases tried, whether tried at OATH or DCT and the recommendation of the trial hearing officer/commissioner/ALJ
      -- Final disposition of allegation by the Police Commissioner
      -- for Command A or Command B disciplinary outcomes (pleas, summarily imposed, or after trial), please give the actual penalty imposed at the command 

If a modification of this request would assist in easier fulfillment (e.g. to drop a particular category of information that presents difficulties), please contact me by email to discuss the issue.

Please provide the information electronically in a spreadsheet format (Excel, .csv) if possible, with all text machine-readable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Bodah

The Civilian Complaint Review Board (CCRB) has closed your FOIL request FOIL-2021-054-00269 for the following reasons: (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2021-054-00269) 
 Your request under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) is being closed because the document or information you requested is publicly available. 
  * CCRB has provided large amounts of information on the NYC OpenData website: https://data.cityofnewyork.us/browse?Dataset-Information_Agency=Civilian+Complaint+Review+Board+%28CCRB%29&q=&sortBy=last_modified&utf8=%E2%9C%93 
You may appeal the decision to deny access to material that was redacted in part or withheld in entirety by contacting the agency's FOIL Appeals Officer: foil@ccrb.nyc.gov within 30 days. (mailto:foil@ccrb.nyc.gov?subject=FOIL-2021-054-00269%20-%20Appeal)

title: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Michigan Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: AFC budgets

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: AFC budgets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. budgets and actual spending on attorneys for the child in 2021, 2020, 2019, 2018, and 2017.
2. contractor audits of attorney for the child spending since 2019.

These records are subject to FOIL per OCA's list of FOIL subject material available at https://www.nycourts.gov/LegacyPDFS/Foil/Foil-subjectMatter-List.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

title: BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022.

Via email: publicrecords@bsd405.org

GOOD MORNING!

To whom it may concern,

WASHINGTON STATE OFFICE OF SUPERINTENDENT OF PUBLIC INSTRUCTION - EQUITY AND CIVIL RIGHTS (https://www.k12.wa.us/policy-funding/equity-and-civil-rights):

"The Washington State legislature notes that schools should be a place in which all youth feel safe. With racial equity as a central component of safety and security planning, it is imperative that all school safety and security staff not contribute to an unsafe environment for Black youth and youth of color."

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3. Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

Note: If your agency chooses not to produce the requested records in reverse chronological order as requested, and/or chooses to sandbag this request by dribbling out a few records per installment every 6 months (tee-hee), you can expect a separate targeted public records request for each line item by year - submitted via multiple members of the public, multiple times until the requested records are timely produced. This simple three part multi year request would then become twelve (12) separate public records requests. If your agency would prefer 12 separate individual requests, please let us know.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERICAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: PRR 11162022-Anon / RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
PRR 11162022-Anon

Dear Requestor:
On behalf of the Bellevue School District, I am acknowledging receipt of your public records request, received on November 16, 2022. Your request has been assigned tracking number PRR 11162022-Anon.
I understand your request to be:

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3. Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.
Is this an accurate statement of your request? If not, please let me know.
We have begun locating and gathering records potentially responsive to your request and estimate our first production of records to you will be on or before December 14, 2022. If the records are available sooner, I will provide them to you.

If you have any questions or concerns, please let me know – I’m always happy to help.

Best Regards,
Sarah

P.S. I enjoyed the “tee-hee” in your Records Installments section; that doesn’t turn up in many records requests and it made me laugh. (Also, I promise: no sandbagging.)

communications.subject: 1st Production / PRR 11162022-Anon / RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety...
communications.communication:
PRR 11162022-Anon

Dear Requestor:

Attached please find the Bellevue School District’s first records production installment in response to your November 16, 2022 request.


  *   In response to Item #1 (School Safety and Security Data collection report 2019-2022):

This is the first year that BSD’s Security department has been asked to complete the OSPI School Safety and Security Data collection report. As such, the only record responsive to this portion of your request is the attached July 6, 2022 email chain titled “Re: Question about Safety & Security Staff survey.”


  *   In response to Item #2 (contracts and/or agreements with law enforcement organization or agency 2019-2022):

Attached please find a copy of the BPS and BSD 2013 Interlocal Agreement – September 2013, covering the period from 2013-2020. Due to the district’s shift to remote learning in March of 2020, the Bellevue police officers formerly assigned to the school district returned to patrol duties and have not returned to the district. There are no current contracts with law enforcement organizations or agencies.


  *   In response to Item #3 (contact information for various safety and security personnel 2019-2022):

Please find the attached Security Department Employee List with contact information for BSD Security staff from 2019-2022. We continue to gather records relating to other safety and security personnel, campus security officers or security guard personal who may be assigned to the district.

I anticipate that our next production of responsive records will be on or before February 10, 2023. If records are available sooner, I will provide them to you.

Please let me know if you have questions.
Best regards,
Sarah

Sarah Kolpacoff
Public Records Officer
General Counsel’s Office
Bellevue School District No. 405
(425) 456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

title: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Lacey Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Lacey Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions.

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of January 09, 2023, Reference # J009963-010923 

Dear Rose, 

The Lacey Police Department received a public records request from you on January 09, 2023. Your request mentioned: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flacey-police-department-634%252Fpolice-staff-roster-january-2023-lacey-police-department-138574%252F%253Femail%253Dlaceypolice%252540ci.lacey.wa.us&url_auth_token=AACLROCMKCBOwT4tVptGkQb1OQo%3A1pF3hZ%3A-a-lzXoJzzDBXceAPwM2QG_tlOixw7shryPbNtWyJmM 

Your request is currently being researched and has been interpreted as follows: requested details of each officer here at the City of Lacey Police Department. If this is an incorrect interpretation of your request please let me know as soon as possible so the search can be adjusted; otherwise, you can expect to receive a response on or before 2/10/2023. 

If you have any questions or wish to discuss this further, please contact me at 360-459-4333. 

Sincerely, 

Crystal Meyers 
Police Assistant III 
Lacey Police Department - Staff on leave

title: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022.

Via email: galt.pettett@rsd.edu

To whom it may concern,

WASHINGTON STATE OFFICE OF SUPERINTENDENT OF PUBLIC INSTRUCTION - EQUITY AND CIVIL RIGHTS (https://www.k12.wa.us/policy-funding/equity-and-civil-rights):

"The Washington State legislature notes that schools should be a place in which all youth feel safe. With racial equity as a central component of safety and security planning, it is imperative that all school safety and security staff not contribute to an unsafe environment for Black youth and youth of color."

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1.	Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2.	Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3.	Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

Note: If your agency chooses not to produce the requested records in reverse chronological order as requested, and/or chooses to sandbag this request by dribbling out a few records per installment every 6 months (tee-hee), you can expect a separate targeted public records request for each line item by year - submitted via multiple members of the public, multiple times until the requested records are timely produced. This simple three part multi year request would then become twelve (12) separate public records requests. If your agency would prefer 12 separate individual requests, please let us know.


PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERICAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Public Records Requests R000001-020722, R000175-111622, R000176-111622 and R000177-111622
communications.communication:
[cid:image002.png@01D8FA93.8D4AB690]

November 17, 2022

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 120953
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Public Records Requests R000001-020722,  and New Requests

To Whom It May Concern:

"On November 4, 2021 the Richland School District received your first records request. Your request was sent from the e-mail address 120953-42737343@requests.muckrock.com.  Your request sought the following records:

…all Public Records Requests received by Richland School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

 

On November 8th and 9th, the District sent you two requests for clarification.  Then on November 15, the District e-mailed you.  The body of the District’s e-mail is as follows:

This District has assigned your request with the number 1142021MR for tracking purposes.  Please use this number when corresponding about this request.

Since receiving your request, I have sent at least two requests for clarification to your group and have not heard back.  I corresponded using the portal specific to the Richland School District and assigned by your group. I have not heard back from you.

I am seeking clarification of your very large records request so that the District can provide you with an adequate response.  Is there a staff member that I can speak to for this clarification?  Understanding that you are on the other side of the country, is there a good day and time for me to call?

 

Also on November 15th, you provided an initial clarification.  That same day the District acknowledged your clarification.  The District’s response is as follows:

I understand your request to be for a complete electronic copy of all public records requests received by the Richland School District #400 including the District’s responses for the years 2021-2021.

What I need clarification on is are you requesting all correspondence not just the initial request and the District’s response as there are time like this, that the District asks for clarification.  Further, there are requests that are abandoned.  By that I mean, the Requestor does not clarify or does not come to retrieve the responsive records.

Additionally, are you including requests for video in your request?  If so, the District will need to give third parties adequate notice of your request and the opportunity to seek an injunction.

I would prefer to speak over the phone with the member from your team who is making this request so that we can use our time more efficiently in responding to your request.  Please feel free to contact me directly.

 

You responded on November 16th by stating that your request was for copies of any public records requests received by the District and any responses to these requests by the District, including abandoned requests and requests for video. You also acknowledged the District’s need to give third-party notice.

 

On November 22, the District informed you that it was in the process of compiling a list of individuals who the District would need to provide third-party notice to and their contact information.  The District notified you that it was beginning the process of reviewing the responsive records to determine if there were any other necessary redactions. 

 

Based on the complexity of your request, the need to provide third party notice, and the need to carefully review the records for redactions, the District informed you it estimated it would take fourteen months to fully respond to your request. The District informed you that it would be providing the responsive records to you in installments.

 

The District also noted that it was in the process of updating its public records policy.  Part of that policy update related to fees associated with processing and answering records request. 

 

Starting on November 23rd, the District began received a large number of phone calls and e-mails from the individuals who had received the third-party notices.  Most individuals were concerned with who had requested the information and how the records would be used.

 

In a letter to you on December 1st the District asked that you complete a commercial purposes declaration.  This declaration clearly states that you are not seeking lists of employees and their disclosable information for commercial purposes.

 

On December 6th, the District received notice from you that you were neither seeking records for commercial purposes nor were you requesting any production of responsive documents that required a commercial purposes declaration. 

 

The District continued to receive considerable communications from third parties it had provided notice to regarding your request. Also, the District was reviewing the responsive records to make sure they included all necessary redactions and contained a redaction log.

 

The District e-mailed you installments to your records request by e-mail on the following dates:

January 3, 2022

February 3, 2022

February 3, 2022

February 4, 2022

 

On February 22nd, the District notified you that it was migrating to the GovQA platform to received, process and release all public records requests.  One of the many reasons for this migration is that the District can release responsive files that are significantly larger than what the District’s e-mail system can accommodate.  This allows for records to be release quicker.

 

On March 3rd, you notified the District that while the District was free to use the GovQA platform, you as a Requestor were under no obligation to use the platform. Further you started, “… as such I respectfully refuse.”  Further you wrote e-mailed the District:

The District is directed to provide the requested public records via email or direct no-password, no registration, internet file sharing link. If this is not possible, then responsive records my be provided via US MAIL.

US MAIL ADDRESS:

MuckRock
PRR: N000395-110421
411A Highland Ave
Somerville, MA 02144

On March 17th, the District e-mailed you the following response:

As you know the District has been working to provide your agency with all responsive records.  Since starting to answer your request the District has begun using the GovQA portal/platform to assist the District in tracking and answering public records requests.  One of the reasons the District made this change is that prior to using GovQA, the District was limited in the size of the file it could send requestors.  GovQA does not have the limitations that the District’s e-mail server has.

Understanding that you are requesting the District to accommodate your request not to use GovQA, the District proposes that it start sending your group thumb drives that contain the responsive records.  The downside to this is that the thumb drives and postage will cost money.  Your group would be responsible for these fees.  Whereas if the District continued to answer your request using GovQA the District would not charge you a fee.

Please let us know how you would like to proceed.  The District has been inundated with public records request for the past several weeks, but we are committed to providing you with regular installments.

 

You acknowledged the District’s e-mail. You again said you would accept response records via US mail and again provided your mailing address in Sumerville, MA.

On March 17th, the District provided you with the following correspondence:

Dear MuckRock,

Richland School District received a public information request from you on November 04, 2021 and it is being processed in accordance with Chapter 42.56 RCW, the Washington State Public Records Act.

The District assigned your request with the reference number R000001-020722 for tracking purposes.  Please use this number when communicating about your request.

You requested the following records:

“all public records requests received by the District from November 14, 2011 through November 14, 2021. This includes the initial request, all responsive records from the District, and any redaction logs. Further your request also includes abandoned requests and requests for video records. Excluding list of names seeming for commercial purposes”

As you know the District has been working to provide your agency with all responsive records.  Since starting to answer your request the District has began using the GovQA portal/platform to assist the District in tracking and answering public records requests.  One of the reasons the District made this change is that prior to using GovQA, the District was limited in the size of the file it could send requestors.  GovQA does not have the limitations that the District’s e-mail server has.

Understanding that you are requesting the District to accommodate your request not to use GovQA, the District proposes that it start sending your group thumb drives that contain the responsive records.  The down side to this is that the thumb drives and postage will cost money.  Your group would be responsible for these fees.  Whereas if the District continued to answer your request using GovQA the District would not charge you a fee.

Please let us know how you would like to proceed.  The District has been inundated with public records request for the past several weeks, but we are committed to providing you with regular installments.

If you have any questions, please reply to this email. Thank you for your attention.

April 1st, 2022 – the District mailed you a thumb drive that contained 240 files of responsive records.  It also contained a bill for $36.95. This was sent to your mailing address.  The address the District used was:

MuckRock
PRR: N000395-110421
411A Highland Ave
Somerville, MA 02144

 

On May 4th the District communicated to you the following:

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 04, 2021, Reference # R000001-020722.

Dear MuckRock,

We have not received your payment on invoice number INV22-R000001-1 for Public Records requested by you on November 04, 2021 with Request Number R000001-020722.  

Please see attached or login to the Public Records Request Center to view details.

You can make a check or money order payable to: Richland School District and mail to:

Attn: Nayomi Munguia
6972 Keene Road
West Richland WA 99353

Sincerely,  

Galt Pettett
Certified Public Records Officer
Legal

On September 20, 2022, the District sent to you a thumb drive to replace the two that you reported that you had not received.  There was no charge or fee for this as the last two that we have sent to you, have not been received by your organization.

 

The District is currently loading another installment of responsive record to a thumb drive and will mail it to you by the end of the week. The District will make sure this thumb drive is sent to your new address.

 

Over the past few days, the District has received several new requests from you.  On November 14, 2022, the District received the following public records request from you:

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2021. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2021 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2021.

3. Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2020. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

4. Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2020 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2020.

5. Provide a complete copy of your agency Joint Legislative Audit and Review Committee (JLARC) report submitted by your agency to JLARC for the year 2019. Note: this identifiable record should be an exact copy of the answers submitted to the JLARC Public Records Request Reporting System.

6. Provide complete copies of any and all worksheets, drafts, estimates, notes, and emails related to the completion of your agency’s final 2019 JLARC report and answers to the JLARC website questionnaire submitted for the year 2019.

The District acknowledges receiving your request.  The District has assigned this request the number R000176-111622. Please refer to this number when communicating about this request and please use it for tracking purposes.    

Then on November 15, 2022, the District received another records request from you.  In this request you sought:

1. I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2019 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2019.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSRIPTS in the year 2019 can be excluded from this request.

The District has assigned this request the number R000175-111622.  Please refer to this number when communicating about this request and please use it for tracking purposes.    

Today, the District received the following request from you:

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3. Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

The District acknowledges receiving this request.  The District has assigned it the number R000177-111622.  Please refer to this number when communicating about this request and please use it for tracking purposes.

 

Again, the District is currently working on providing you with all responsive records to your original request. Richland School District Policy 4040 – Public Records Request provides in part, “When the same requester simultaneously submits multiple, separate requests or makes one or more additional requests when previous requests are open, the District may queue the requests in the order in which they were received. The District is not required to work on an additional request until the initial requests are completed and closed. Requesters are responsible for informing the Public Records Officer if they want to reprioritize the fulfillment of their requests.”

 

Therefore the District will answer your requests in the order it received them. If you want to prioritize your requests, please do so and let the District know which request you want the District to work on.

 

Unless you reprioritize the records requests, the District will continue to provide you with all responsive records to request #R000001-020722.  Within twenty working days after the District completes request # R000001-020722, it will provide you with the first installment of responsive records to request #R000175-111622. Then within twenty workings days after the District provides you with all responsive records to request ##R000175-111622, the District will provide you with the first installment of the responsive records to request #R000176-111622. And within twenty working days following completing request ##R000176-111622,the District will provide you with the first installment of request #R000177-111622. 

 

Please let me know if I misunderstood your request in any way or if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely,

 

 

Galt L. Pettett

Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian

Richland School District #400

6972 Keene Road

West Richland, WA  99353

galt.pettett@rsd.edu

(509)967-6009"

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: RICHLAND SCHOOL DISTRICT – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon:

I would like to start off as stating I am truly sorry for any frustration I have caused you. I take great pride in providing excellent services to Requestors. I am in no way trying to frustrate you or not comply with the Washington State Public Records Act.

In 2021, the Richland School District received a records request from an e-mail address containing “muckrock” in it.  In that request, the Requestor sought several years of records requests and the District’s response to those records request.  The District has been answering this original request by sending installments to the Boston address below.

Then in November, your request and others were received by the District from an e-mail address with “muckrock” in it.  Since these requests were all from “muckrock”, the District presumed they were all from the same organization.

Are there different employees of Muckrock making different requests?  Again, I truly want to provide you with the records you want and do not want to frustrate you, but maybe I don’t understand the Muckrock organization.

Any insight you can provide would be appreciated.

Thank you,

Galt L. Pettett
Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian
Richland School District #400
6972 Keene Road
West Richland, WA  99353
galt.pettett@rsd.edu<mailto:galt.pettett@rsd.edu>
(509)967-6009

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000183-120922
communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock - SRO: 
Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 11/16/2022 and given the reference number R000183-120922 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: 1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3. Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate all responsive records and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted within five business days about the availability and/or provided with copies of responsive records or provided with an estimate of time it will take the District to answer your request. 
Please note that the Washington State Public Records Act does not require the District to create new records, to conduct legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Richland School District 
 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Request Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1Har4pEM4U1SR66a9o2fNaoQnxOVdsC7lEhV-2BZmtspYM-2FuBqV-2FBaCYPJDc1e06M5j5g-3D-3DdSz5_nnkcKP3DwFpXTku2XB0cVFAdQSrGuF17wunQB84K6tH1h5rzHfvMU8jW0YlmjO9ph6YhiRisx9TvvXccoSaMmlZEuulnaXrVzAdC6qazTo9Xvxl-2Bdu3TElqqcTYkDw7CygekAvTaFNPF-2BhLgErlrVBd6-2FurKh3TCsH-2BuEG1oUOEBqDzbZDWnxEb3pRA8GX7usB-2Fnv6kd6xdkhIRd1vQ8VxmuKND1zrr1jPpmGxCxoLk-3D)

communications.subject: Public Records Request #R000183-120922
communications.communication:
Good Morning:

The Richland School District received your records request on November 16th.  The District acknowledged the request on November 17th.  At the time, the District believed your request to be from an organization named Muckrock.  As previously explained, the District had received several requests from Muckrock.  As such, the District was answering the requests in the order that they were received.  The District now understands that you are an individual making a public records request through the Muckrock platform.

The District apologizes for the mistake and is prioritizing your request.  You requested the following public records:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3. Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

I have asked the Student Services Department to provide me with the records that answer the first section of your request. I should have those records in the next ten working days.

As you may know, the Richland School District serves students in the cities of Richland and West Richland.  The District only has School Resource Officers (SRO) in the high schools located in the city of Richland.  I have attached the agreement between the District and Richland Police Department.  This contract has not been finalized. This is the current version of the Agreement.

I am also attaching the agreement that has been in place since 2018.  The District will continue to search for any other records that answer this section of your request.

I understand the third section of your request to be for the work contact information for all safety and security staff, school resource officers and any other employee whose primary job is to provide safety and security services at the District’s school during the 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school years.

To answer this section of your request, I have already made contact with the District’s Human Resources Department to obtain the list of all school security staff for the past three school years and their work locations.  I estimate I will have this information to you in the next ten working days.

To answer this section, the District has the same two SROs from the Richland Police Department for the past several years.  Officer Jason Crouch has been assigned to Richland High School for the past several years.  His work telephone number is 509-967-6561.  The school’s address is 930 Long Avenue, Richland Washington 99352.  His work e-mail address is Jason Crouch RHSSecure@rsd.edu<mailto:RHSSecure@rsd.edu>.

Rick Kane is the SRO assigned to Hanford High School. Hanford High School’s address is 450 Hanford Street, Richland Washington, 99354. His work telephone number is 509-967-6521. Officer Kane’s work e-mail address is Rick Kane HHSSecure@rsd.edu<mailto:HHSSecure@rsd.edu>.

The District did have an SRO at Enterprise Middle School a number of years ago.  West Richland Office Nick Letourneau has not been assigned to the West Richland school for at least two years.  The District is researching the officer’s date of departure.

Again, the District apologizes for the mistake and the delay in getting the responsive records to you. We are prioritizing your request and will be providing you with installments of responsive records.

Please let me know if I misunderstood your request in any way or if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

Galt L. Pettett
Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian
Richland School District #400
6972 Keene Road
West Richland, WA  99353
galt.pettett@rsd.edu<mailto:galt.pettett@rsd.edu>
(509)967-6009





------------------------------------------------------------- NOTICE OF PUBLIC DISCLOSURE: This Richland School District e-mail account is public domain. Any correspondence from or to this e-mail account may be a public record. Accordingly, this e-mail, in whole or in part, may be subject to disclosure pursuant to RCW 42.56, regardless of any claim of confidentiality or privilege asserted by an external party.

Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

The District's administration building and all of its schools are closed in observance of the winter break, regardless the District is providing you with another installment of records that answer your request. Another installment to your public records request has been attached to this e-mail.

The District continues to search for all remaining public records that answer your request. I estimate the District will provide you with the next installment in the next ten working days.

Beginning December 1, 2022 the District will be charging for all public records requests.  Please see our policy and procedures for our fee schedule https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820578  and  https://app.eduportal.com/documents/view/820577

If I have misunderstood your request in any way or you have any questions, please reply to this email.
